ranked_diseases.explanation: Medullary Cystic Kidney Disease can lead to chronic kidney failure and is associated with gout due to urea retention.
This condition is characterized by hyperuricemia (leading to gout) and progressive renal failure.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Autosomal Dominant Tubulointerstitial Kidney Disease, Uromodulin-Related
ranked_diseases.explanation: Caused by mutations in the UMOD gene, it includes features of chronic kidney disease and gout.
Although more commonly presenting with renal stones, this condition can lead to renal failure and has a secondary gout due to renal damage.
Although less common, Fabry Disease can cause kidney problems leading to chronic kidney disease, and indirectly contribute to gout.
